body:
<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:

Conformance test failed:
- `[sig-cli] Kubectl client Kubectl logs should be able to retrieve and filter logs  [Conformance]`

xref https://github.com/cncf/k8s-conformance/issues/746

```
Dec 17 20:19:54.514: INFO: Running '/usr/local/bin/kubectl --kubeconfig=/tmp/kubeconfig-582524409 logs logs-generator logs-generator --namespace=kubectl-2096 --limit-bytes=1'
Dec 17 20:19:54.563: INFO: stderr: ""
Dec 17 20:19:54.563: INFO: stdout: "I1217 20:19:52.996209       1 logs_generator.go:76] 0 PUT /api/v1/namespaces/default/pods/x9r 496\nI1217 20:19:53.196605       1 logs_generator.go:76] 1 PUT /api/v1/namespaces/kube-system/pods/dkb 259\nI1217 20:19:53.396285       1 logs_generator.go:76] 2 GET /api/v1/namespaces/ns/pods/27r 295\nI1217 20:19:53.596294       1 logs_generator.go:76] 3 POST /api/v1/namespaces/default/pods/csh 365\nI1217 20:19:53.796285       1 logs_generator.go:76] 4 GET /api/v1/namespaces/kube-system/pods/xm7 355\nI1217 20:19:53.996275       1 logs_generator.go:76] 5 PUT /api/v1/namespaces/default/pods/hmvn 559\nI1217 20:19:54.196280       1 logs_generator.go:76] 6 POST /api/v1/namespaces/kube-system/pods/w6gd 473\nI1217 20:19:54.396273       1 logs_generator.go:76] 7 PUT /api/v1/namespaces/ns/pods/rc2 534\n"
Dec 17 20:19:54.563: INFO: Unexpected unequal occurred: 8 and 1
Dec 17 20:19:54.563: FAIL: Expected
    <int>: 8
to equal
    <int>: 1
```

**What you expected to happen**:

I expected this conformance test to pass.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

We have configured docker's logging driver to use journald, and then ran sonobouy tests against a k8s 1.16.3 cluster.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
$ kkrc version
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"15", GitVersion:"v1.15.3", GitCommit:"2d3c76f9091b6bec110a5e63777c332469e0cba2", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-09-03T18:55:44Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.9", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"16", GitVersion:"v1.16.3", GitCommit:"b3cbbae08ec52a7fc73d334838e18d17e8512749", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-11-13T11:13:49Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.12", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`): Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.7 (Maipo)
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): 5.3.11-1.el7.elrepo.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Nov 12 14:45:59 EST 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools:
- Network plugin and version (if this is a network-related bug):
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG CLI.
labels.name: sig/cli

title: kubectl logs ... --limit-bytes option is ignored for docker legacy logging
